alert.note: Alert for San Luis Obispo County Beaches; Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued June 15 at 8:03PM PDT until June 16 at 2:00AM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM PDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents and breaking waves due to elevated surf of 5 to 8 feet. Minor tidal overflow around the time of high tide. * WHERE...San Luis Obispo County Beaches and Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches. * WHEN...Until 2 AM PDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Pooling of sea water is possible around high tide at beach and harbor areas that is uncommon with normal tidal ranges. Enhanced beach erosion is also possible. No significant damage is expected. There is an increased risk of drowning due to the hazardous conditions. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Waves can wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats nearshore. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A high tide of 7.0 to 7.2 feet will occur this evening around 1100 pm PDT.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to hazardous swimming conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Stay off rock jetties, as they can be deadly locations in such conditions.

area.areaDesc: San Luis Obispo County Beaches; Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches
